events.originalText: The British travel company Thomas Cook Group ceased operations with immediate effect, leaving around 600,000 tourists stranded around the world.
events.subtitle: Thomas Cook Group
events.headline: Thomas Cook Group Ceases Operations, Leaving 600,000 Tourists Stranded Worldwide

events.originalText: Following a number of high-profile sexual assaults, major reforms were enacted to strengthen laws related to rape in Germany.
events.subtitle: Rape in Germany
events.headline: Germany Enacts Reforms to Strengthen Laws on Rape After High-Profile Assaults

events.originalText: Teresa Lewis became the first woman to be executed by the U.S. state of Virginia since 1912, and the first woman in the state to be executed via lethal injection.
events.subtitle: Teresa Lewis
events.headline: Teresa Lewis Executed in Virginia, First Woman Since 1912

events.originalText: Teresa Lewis became the first woman to be executed by the U.S. state of Virginia since 1912, and the first woman in the state to be executed by lethal injection.
events.subtitle: Teresa Lewis
events.headline: Gunman Kills Ten Students at Seinäjoki University in Finland

events.originalText: A gunman shot and killed ten students at the Seinäjoki University of Applied Sciences in Kauhajoki, Finland, before committing suicide.
events.subtitle: Kauhajoki school shooting
events.headline: Richard Nixon Delivers Checkers Speech in U.S. Vice-Presidential Campaign

events.originalText: U.S. vice-presidential candidate Richard Nixon delivered the Checkers speech (pictured), one of the first political uses of television to appeal directly to the populace.
events.subtitle: Richard Nixon
events.headline: Louisiana Hurricane Dissipates Over Kansas After Evacuating 4,500 People

events.originalText: The Louisiana hurricane dissipated over Kansas after forcing around 4,500 people to evacuate and causing $1.45 million in damages.
events.subtitle: 1920 Louisiana hurricane
events.headline: United Mine Workers Begin Strike Against Colorado Fuel & Iron Company

events.originalText: The United Mine Workers of America begin a strike against the Rockefeller-owned Colorado Fuel & Iron Company, sparking the Colorado Coalfield War.
events.subtitle: United Mine Workers of America
events.headline: French Steamship Arctique Runs Aground, Triggering Tierra del Fuego Gold Rush

events.originalText: The French steamship Arctique ran aground on the northern coast of Cape Virgenes in Argentina; gold was discovered during the rescue effort, triggering the Tierra del Fuego gold rush.
events.subtitle: Cape Virgenes
events.headline: British East India Company Defeats Maratha Troops at Battle of Assaye

events.originalText: Maratha troops were defeated by forces of the British East India Company at the Battle of Assaye, one of the decisive battles of the Second Anglo-Maratha War.
events.subtitle: Maratha Empire
events.headline: Patriots Capture British Officer John André, Exposing Benedict Arnold's Plot

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British officer John André was captured by Patriot forces, thereby revealing a plot by Continental Army general Benedict Arnold to hand over West Point, New York.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Royalists Win Battle of Powick Bridge in First English Civil War

events.originalText: First English Civil War: The Battle of Powick Bridge, the first engagement between the primary field armies of the Royalists and the Parliamentarians, ended in a Royalist victory.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Pope Callixtus II and Emperor Henry V End Investiture Controversy with Concordat of Worms

events.originalText: Pope Callixtus II and Holy Roman emperor Henry V agreed to the Concordat of Worms (pictured), ending the Investiture Controversy.
events.subtitle: Pope Callixtus II
